text.p: Following are some of the leading stories in the Swedish papers this morning. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Unemployment will be the key focal point at this week's conference of Sweden's leftist political parties at Visby. The Moderates will hold an economic seminar on Monday and the Social Democrats will follow suit on Tuesday.

- The market for still, soft drinks increased last year with a fierce battle between Mer and Festis. These flat, fruity drinks secured 5.4 percent of the total soft drink market last year and their popularity is growing. Mer and Festis combined dominate 70 percent of this sector while Coca Cola's Fruitopia, Spendrup's Lift and Kraft Freias Sunkist lag behind.
- Sweden's Crown Princess Victoria celebrates her 20th birthday with a party at Borgholm on Oland island. The entertainers will include Swedish band Ace of Base.
- Lars-Johan Jarnheimer, 37, finishes his job as managing director of mobile telephone company Comviq to become marketing director for Saab.

- Bearings maker SKF is one of the winners on the Stockholm bourse this summer. Analysts think the company's half year report on Tuesday will show a pre-tax profit of 1.1 billion crowns. Since the start of June the company's B-series share price has risen 23 percent which is twice as good as the general index.
- Only published on Fridays during the summer.
